result.execSummary:
The defendant William F Acosta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by end of extended supervision in 13CF3542.  Court ordered that all cost, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant to serve 99 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 99 days time served.  As a convicted felon, he must provide a DNA sample, voting rights are suspended and may never possess firearms.
Consecutive to: any other sentence
Court advised defendant that due to his DV conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William F Acosta

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant William F Acosta in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William F Acosta in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 99 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 99 days time served.  Court defendant to pay all costs and surcharges by the end of extended supervision in 13CF3542.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief.
.
Court advised defendant that due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant William F Acosta in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William F Acosta in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/8/15 in Branch 40.

Defendant William F Acosta in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William F Acosta in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Parties are still in negotiations and would like another date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant William F Acosta in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William F Acosta in custody.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Defendant requested new counsel.  After a discussion with the Court, the defendant withdrew his request.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.    Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF3542 and 14CF599 that are attached to the complaint.  Sworn for the state:  ADA Investigator Joseph Link.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Due to the unavailability of the witness, the 6/03/15 preliminary hearing is rescheduled to 6/08/15 at 1:30 pm.  rmm

ADDRESS INFO for William F Acosta
Current: 1219 S 18th Street Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 05-27-2015)
Prior: 926 South 36th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53215

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Jessyka K.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant William F Acosta in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant William F Acosta in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
